input:

13:13 Caption: Bernard (Shakhtar) takes a short corner kick.
13:26 Caption: Shakhtar Donetsk are enjoying a spell of pressure at the moment, but one of the defenders gets it clear. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Shakhtar Donetsk.

44:57 Caption: What a big chance! Alex Teixeira (Shakhtar) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
46:29 Caption: Decent spell from Malmo FF here and they keep the pressure on until one of the defending players steps in. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Malmo FF will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
47:11 Caption: Vladimir Rodic (Malmo FF) sends a wonderful cross from the corner kick. However, the defence works perfectly to clear the ball and avert the threat. It will be a corner kick for Malmo FF.
47:24 Caption: Vladimir Rodic (Malmo FF) prepares to take a corner kick.
47:48 Caption: Kari Arnason (Malmo FF) leaps highest to meet the resulting set piece and sends his header way off target.
48:58 Caption: The first half of today's match has just finished.
48:59 Caption: Both sides have been very active in the first half, providing the fans with an exciting show. It was a fairly one-sided opening 45 minutes, with Shakhtar Donetsk much the better side better so far. The home team play long-ball football, while the away side focuses on defending and lets the opposition keep possession.

He received the ball from the free kick, took a good first touch and unleashed a projectile from close range to the left side of the goal, but Johan Wiland makes a nice save. The ball is out of play. Shakhtar Donetsk win a corner kick.
41:54 Event: Corner by Shakhtar Donetsk

45:36 Caption: The game has begun to heat up. Alex Teixeira (Shakhtar) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
46:25 Caption: Yoshimar Yotun (Malmo FF) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Ovidiu Hategan no option but to blow his whistle.
47:58 Caption: There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
47:59 Caption: All in all that was an entertaining 90 minutes of football thanks to some decent attacking play. Shakhtar Donetsk were dominant and more threatening of the two sides. It was a fairly one-sided match. The home side played long passes and crosses into the box, while the away team's main priority was a flawless defence.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In an electrifying match at Donbass Arena, Shakhtar Donetsk demolished Malmo FF with an emphatic 4-0 victory, demonstrating a masterclass in both offensive prowess and defensive stability. The exciting encounter was marked by a dominant performance from the hosts, who capitalized on their chances effectively while thwarting any significant threats from the visitors.

The match commenced with Shakhtar Donetsk kicking off and setting the tone early. Within just 40 seconds, the home team was already making their intentions clear with a shot on target. Malmo responded swiftly, firing a shot off target at the 1:15 mark, but the ball drifted out of play. The opening minutes were characterized by frequent ball exchanges and clearances, indicative of the high tempo and intensity both teams brought into the game.

A significant moment came at 10:14 when Malmo was forced to make an early substitution as Oscar Lewicki could not continue due to injury and was replaced by Erdal Rakip. This interruption slightly unsettled the visitors, granting Shakhtar more opportunities to build their attacks. Shakhtar’s offensive efforts were relentless, with Bernard and Oleksandr Gladky at the forefront, repeatedly threatening the Malmo defense.

Around the 12th minute, Shakhtar earned consecutive corners, pressuring the Malmo defense. Though their initial efforts were thwarted, the persistence paid off. At 27:42, Shakhtar’s Alex Teixeira found himself on the receiving end of a rebound from a saved header by Oleksandr Gladky. Teixeira expertly headed the ball, which Johan Wiland couldn't keep out, thus breaking the deadlock and giving Shakhtar a deserved lead.

The remainder of the first half saw Shakhtar maintain their dominance, with Gladky and Teixeira continuing to unsettle the Malmo defense. Malmo had a few promising moments, notably a save by Shakhtar’s Anton Kanibolotsky from Nikola Djurdjic’s attempt. Nonetheless, it was Shakhtar who kept the pressure on, illustrated by a disallowed goal for offside and several close shaves, including a header that narrowly missed the target.

The second half began with tactical changes from both sides. Malmo brought on Yoshimar Yotun for Jo Inge Berget, while Shakhtar replaced Oleksandr Gladky with Eduardo. The game resumed with Malmo's kick-off. Almost immediately, Shakhtar earned a penalty following a foul by Kari Arnason. Darijo Srna stepped up and converted with aplomb, doubling Shakhtar’s lead just minutes into the second half.

Malmo struggled to regain their composure, and Shakhtar continued to dominate possession and create chances. Eduardo's impact was almost instantaneous; he connected with a perfect cross from Bernard to score Shakhtar's third goal at the 09:30 mark. Eduardo’s header was expertly placed, giving Wiland no chance, and effectively putting the game beyond Malmo’s reach.

Maintaining their momentum, Shakhtar kept pressing and passing with precision. Their cohesion was evident, and the fourth goal was a testament to their superior teamwork. At 27:15, a quick rebound inside the six-yard box found its way to Teixeira again, who headed it into the net, sealing Malmo’s fate at 4-0.

Malmo’s frustrations began to show, particularly through a string of fouls and a subsequent red card for Kari Arnason due to a second booking. With Arnason’s dismissal, Malmo's chances of staging any comeback diminished significantly. Shakhtar continued to control the pace, exchanging passes and orchestrating attacks while maintaining defensive solidity.

Shakhtar’s consistent pressure was underscored by statistics: dominating possession, registering more attempts on goal, and making more critical interceptions. The hosts’ defensive unit led by Marcio Azevedo and Oleksandr Kucher efficiently neutralized Malmo’s attacking forays, ensuring a clean sheet for the hosts.

In addition to the goals, the game saw numerous individual battles and tactical fouls, leading to several yellow cards for both sides. Despite Malmo’s efforts to reduce the deficit, Shakhtar’s disciplined performance ensured they stayed in control till the final whistle.

The referee blew for full time, concluding an eventful 90 minutes. Shakhtar's fans roared in approval, celebrating a comprehensive victory that showcased their team’s attacking flair and defensive resilience in equal measures. 

From the opening whistle to the last kick, Shakhtar Donetsk outclassed Malmo in every facet of the game. The fluid passing, cohesive movement, and clinical finishing of the home team were strikingly superior to the visitors’ efforts. Malmo, who primarily focused on a defensive game plan, found themselves overwhelmed by Shakhtar's relentless attacking waves.

The match was indeed a one-sided affair, illustrating Shakhtar Donetsk's quality and determination to secure the win. It was a lesson in tactical effectiveness, execution, and maintaining pressure - a performance that fans and analysts alike will remember for its sheer dominance and clinical nature. 

Oleksandr Gladky’s and Eduardo's goals punctuated Shakhtar’s superiority, while Darijo Srna’s composed penalty highlighted the team’s experience and professionalism. For Malmo, it was a day to forget, but also one to learn from as they were second-best in almost every point of contention throughout the match.

Spectators witnessed a comprehensive dismantling of Malmo, with Shakhtar demonstrating why they are a formidable force in European football. This match will serve as an exemplary display of how to combine defensive robustness with attacking ruthlessness, ensuring not just victory, but an emphatic one that resonates beyond the final whistle.
